body_html: There seems to be some recent changes in the PTB model which are not part of 0.11.0rc0. This include, among other things, interface changes in tensorflow.models.rnn.ptb.reader, in particular the ptb_producer function, that is not present in 0.11.0rc0. When you do import tensorflow.models.rnn.ptb.reader you are importing the PTB reader module from your installation, which is not compatible with the current PTB model in master; so changing the line to the relative import import reader works. Another option would be to checkout the tag 0.11.0rc0 in your cloned git repo.
body_text: There seems to be some recent changes in the PTB model which are not part of 0.11.0rc0. This include, among other things, interface changes in tensorflow.models.rnn.ptb.reader, in particular the ptb_producer function, that is not present in 0.11.0rc0. When you do import tensorflow.models.rnn.ptb.reader you are importing the PTB reader module from your installation, which is not compatible with the current PTB model in master; so changing the line to the relative import import reader works. Another option would be to checkout the tag 0.11.0rc0 in your cloned git repo.
body: There seems to be some recent changes in the PTB model which are not part of 0.11.0rc0. This include, among other things, interface changes in `tensorflow.models.rnn.ptb.reader`, in particular the `ptb_producer` function, that is not present in 0.11.0rc0. When you do `import tensorflow.models.rnn.ptb.reader` you are importing the PTB `reader` module from your installation, which is not compatible with the current PTB model in `master`; so changing the line to the relative import `import reader` works. Another option would be to checkout the tag 0.11.0rc0 in your cloned git repo.
